context.description: example
Replace the selected resource(s) with those that are tagged with the selected tag.
Compare the selected resource(s) with those that are tagged with the selected tag.
Tags the selected resource(s) with the selected tag, moving the tag if required.
Synchronizes the previously unshared project with the selected branch of the corresponding remote project
Tags the project with the version name provided.
Project already has CVS information. Continuing will allow the use of CVS operations.
Here you can select an exisiting repository to use.
Here you can create a new repository to use for your project.
Here you can decide whether to use the project name as the module name or give the module a different name.
All you need to do now is hit the 'Finish' button to share the project.
Here you can select where you want to save the patch.
Here you can specify the kind of patch you would like.
Finds all differences between remote and local versions of the project.
Find all outgoing changes.
Updates the remote project with any changes that have been made locally.
Updates the local project with any changes that have been made remotely.
Creates a patch that can be applied to the base project to bring it in sync with this copy.
Tags a project with a version name that you can provide.
Branch off a project into 2 streams.
Merge 2 disparate streams into one cohesive whole.
Stop managing the project with this repo provider.
Add this file to the repository
Ignore this file for all remote sync operations.
Convert a project that has a CVS nature on it to one that has a persitant property.
Compare the selected resource(s) with the corresponding remote resources tagged with a given version or branch tag.
Compare the selected resource(s) with the corresponding remote resources on the same branch (or HEAD).
Compare the selected file with a given remote revision of the file.
Replace the selected resource(s) with the corresponding remote resources tagged with a given version or branch tag.
Replace the selected resource(s) with the corresponding remote resources on the same branch (or HEAD).
Replace the selected file with a given remote revision of the file.
Checkout the selected resource into a user configured project.
Checkout the selected resource(s) into a project(s) that corresponds to the name of the remote resource.
Checkout the selected module(s) into the local workspace.
Open the contents of the selected remote file into an editor.
Display the revision history of the selected local or remote file in the history view.
Compare the 2 selected remote resources with each other.
Copy the name of the selected repository location to the clipboard.
Remove the selected repository location(s) from the Repositories View.
Add a branch to the selected repository location. This operation only adds the branch to the view and does not effect the repository itself.
Remove a branch from the selected repository location. This operation only removes the branch to the view and does not effect the repository itself.
Tags the selected resource(s) with the selected tag, moving the tag if required.
Tags the selected resource(s) with the selected tag.

Configure the branch and version tags that are shown in the workbench. By browsing remote CVS files for tags you can selectively choose, from the list of tags on each file, which tags should be remembered and which ones shouldn't. You can also select the files that will be automatically examined for tags.

This lists the files that are automatically examined for tags. By default, the .project file is examined. But in some cases other files may have a more complete tag history and should be examined instead.

This will fetch branch and version tags from the files that have been configured to be automatically searched for tags. If tags that you expected to see don't appear, try changing the list of files to examined via the tag configuration dialog.
Enter a comment to describe the contents of this release.
In this dialog, enter the appropriate information to log in to the repository.
Enter the name of the version tag to be applied to the revisions that exist locally.
Enter the name of the branch tag to be applied to the revisions that exist locally.

In this dialog choose how to add the selected resources to the .cvsignore files. For each resource to be ignored, a .cvsignore file will created in its parent directory containing the pattern specified in the dialog. This won't affect resources already under version control.
Enables pruning of empty directories on update and in the synchronization view. Although pruned directories aren't shown in the workbench there is actually still an empty directory in the repository.

Sets the amount of status information CVS prints for a command. In "Somewhat quiet" mode the printing of unimportant informational messages is supressed. The consideration of what is important depends on each command. In "Very quiet" mode all output except what is absolutely necessary to complete the command is suppressed. In "Very Quiet" mode, some cvs servers may not communicate important information about errors that have occured. You may want to consider using "Somewhat quiet" mode instead.

Sets the compression level on communications with the server if it is supported by the server. Level 1 is minimal compression (very fast/low compression) and level 9 maximum compression (very slow/maximum compression).
Sets the default keyword substitution mode to use for text files.
Sets the amount of time in seconds to wait before timing out from a connection to the CVS server.

Sets the default compare method for comparing and synchronizing CVS resources. By default timestamps are used to compare CVS files, and this is by far the fastest method. However, in some cases a more accurate comparison can be achieved by comparing file content. This setting can be toggled from within a compare editor or the synchronization view.
Enables markers to be added to the task view for resources that have been locally removed but not committed and resources that have been locally added but not placed under CVS control.
Allows resources not under CVS control to be deleted when replacing with resources from the repository.
This view shows the output of CVS operations.
This view allows the browsing of a remote CVS repository.
This view shows the revision history of a resource under CVS control.
This view shows the incoming, outgoing and conflicting changes.

This view allows the comparision of the local copy of a file with the revisions from the respoitory. Actions availabel of a revision are "Get Contents" and "Get Revision". Although both replace the local file with the contents of the remote rvision, "Get Revision" will make the local file "sticky". This means that changes to the file cannot be committed back to the repository.
Load the revision of the file into the workspace. The file will be "sticky" and the user will be unable to commit changes to the repository.

Load the contents of the file into the workspace. The base revision of the local file will not change and the file will become dirty. Perform this action if you wich to revert to the contents of an older revision of the file.
Commit outgoing changes to the respository
Commit outgoing changes to the respository
